title: Rename tier to level across entire codebase
description:
Rename all occurrences of "tier" to "level" in code, tests, templates, and comments. This is a comprehensive rename affecting 813 occurrences across 22 files.

## Scope

### File renames (3)
- static/js/tiers.js  static/js/levels.js
- tests/js/test-tiers.js  tests/js/test-levels.js
- tests/test_tiers.py  tests/test_levels.py

### Module/global renames
- var Tiers  var Levels (global module name)
- All Tiers.xxx() calls  Levels.xxx() calls across all consumers

### Function/method renames (key examples)
- tierCount()  levelCount()
- tierLetter()  levelLetter()
- initTier()  initLevel()
- tierAccuracy()  levelAccuracy()
- ensureTierCards()  ensureLevelCards()
- currentTierCards()  currentLevelCards()
- currentTierSpecs()  currentLevelSpecs()
- tryAdvance()  internal refs only
- generateTier()  generateLevel()
- _updateTierInfo()  _updateLevelInfo()
- tierLabel()  levelLabel()
- tierStats()  levelStats()

### State/variable renames
- currentTier  currentLevel
- tierCount  levelCount
- tierNumber  levelNumber
- tierSpecs  levelSpecs
- state.tiers  state.levels
- startTier  startLevel
- nextTier  nextLevel

### Constants
- TIER_LABELS  LEVEL_LABELS
- SYSTEM_TIER_COUNT  SYSTEM_LEVEL_COUNT
- STEPS_8_TIER  STEPS_8_LEVEL (etc.)
- Tiers.MASTERY  Levels.MASTERY

### User-facing strings
- "Tier X"  "Level X" in statusText, progress view
- "All tiers mastered"  "All levels mastered"
